name: arrow
description: Apache Arrow is a cross-language development platform for in-memory data. It specifies a standardized language-independent columnar memory format for flat and hierarchical data, organized for efficient analytic operations on modern hardware. It also provides computational libraries and zero-copy streaming messaging and interprocess communication. Languages currently supported include C, C++, Java, JavaScript, Python, and Ruby.

name: r-helper
description: Commonly used helper functions in R

name: sparseinv
description: Creates a wrapper for the SuiteSparse routines      in C that us the Takahashi equations to compute the elements of the      inverse of a sparse matrix at locations where the (permuted) Cholesky     factor is non-zero. The resulting matrix is known as a sparse inverse     subset. Some helper functions (like the permuted Cholesky factorisation)     are also implemented. Support for spam matrices is currently limited     and will be implemented in the future.
